column4: Peeps, is it true that "iptables -t nat -A PREROUTING -i eth0 -p tcp --dport 80 -j REDIRECT --to-port 3128" will only redirect connections from external IP's to my machine and NOT the ones made from localhost?
I'm no iptables guru but I don't see anything that would restrict to external ip's only..

- cite from en.wikipedia.org/wiki/iptables: "Note: if you launch this command on your computer it will only work for external IP addresses connecting to your machine. Connections from localhost do not traverse the PREROUTING chain in the "nat" table."
well.. guess I'll go sit in the corner wearing the pointy hat =).. as I said.. I'm no guru.. wikipedia sounds like it knows what it's talking about
